net.sf.freecol.util.test

Class FreeColTestCase

  • java.lang.Object
    • junit.framework.Assert
      • junit.framework.TestCase
        • net.sf.freecol.util.test.FreeColTestCase
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    junit.framework.Test
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AIColonyTest, BaseCostDeciderTest, BuildingTest, CLDRTest, ColonyPlanTest, ColonyProductionTest, ColonyTest, CombatTest, ContactTest, DisasterTest, EuropeTest, FontTest, FoundingFatherTest, GameTest, GoodsContainerTest, GoodsTest, HighSeasTest, IndianSettlementTest, IndividualFatherTest, InGameControllerTest, LimitTest, MapGeneratorTest, MapTest, MarketTest, MessagesTest, MissionAssignmentTest, ModelMessageTest, ModifierTest, ModTest, MonarchTest, MovementTest, MoveTest, NationTypeTest, OptionTest, PathfindingTest, PioneeringMissionTest, PlayerTest, PrivateerMissionTest, ProductionTypeTest, RandomRangeTest, REFTest, RoleTest, SaveLoadTest, SchoolTest, ScopeTest, ScoutingMissionTest, SerializationTest, ServerBuildingTest, ServerColonyTest, ServerIndianSettlementTest, ServerPlayerTest, ServerUnitTest, SettlementTest, SoLTest, SoundTest, SpecificationTest, StandardAIPlayerTest, TensionTest, TileImprovementTest, TileItemContainerTest, TileTest, TradeRouteTest, TransportMissionTest, UnitSeekAndDestroyMissionTest, UnitTest, UnitTypeChangeTest, UtilsTest

    public class FreeColTestCase
extends junit.framework.TestCase
    The base class for all FreeCol tests. Contains useful methods used by the individual tests.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FreeColTestCase

        public FreeColTestCase()

    • Method Detail

      • getGame

        public static Game getGame()
        Get a game pseudo-singleton, i.e. the same instance will be returned until getStandardGame() is called, which resets the singleton to a new value. Calling this method repetitively without calling getStandardGame() will result in the same Game being returned.
        Returns:
        The game singleton.

      • setGame

        public static void setGame(Game newGame)
        Specifically sets the game instance to run with. Necessary for server tests that create their own game instances. Allows for same interface for accessing the game instance for all types of tests.
        Parameters:
        newGame - Game instance to work with

      • spec

        public static Specification spec()

      • spec

        public static Specification spec(java.lang.String name)

      • getSpecification

        public static Specification getSpecification(java.lang.String name)

      • getStandardGame

        public static Game getStandardGame()
        Returns a new game, with all players set. As a side effect this call will reset the singleton game value that can be accessed using getGame().
        Returns:
        A new game with with players for each nation added.

      • getStandardGame

        public static Game getStandardGame(java.lang.String specName)
        Returns a new game, with all players set. As a side effect this call will reset the singleton game value that can be accessed using getGame().
        Parameters:
        specName - a String value
        Returns:
        A new game with with players for each nation added.

      • getTestMap

        public static Map getTestMap()
        Creates a standardized map on which all fields have the plains type. Uses the getGame() method to access the currently running game. Does not call Game.setMap(Map) with the returned map. The map is unexplored.
        Returns:
        The map created as described above.

      • getTestMap

        public static Map getTestMap(TileType tileType)
        Creates a standardized map on which all fields have the same given type. Uses the getGame() method to access the currently running game. Does not call Game.setMap(Map) with the returned map. The map is unexplored.
        Parameters:
        tileType - The type of land with which to initialize the map.
        Returns:
        The map created as described above.

      • getTestMap

        public static Map getTestMap(TileType tileType,
                             boolean explored)
        Creates a standardized map on which all fields have the same given type. Uses the getGame() method to access the currently running game. Does not call Game.setMap(Map) with the returned map.
        Parameters:
        tileType - The type of land with which to initialize the map.
        explored - Set to true if you want all the tiles on the map to have been explored by all players.
        Returns:
        The map created as described above.

      • getTestMap

        public static Map getTestMap(boolean explored)

      • getCoastTestMap

        public static Map getCoastTestMap(TileType landTileType)

      • getCoastTestMap

        public static Map getCoastTestMap(TileType landTileType,
                                  boolean explored)
        Creates a standardized map, half land (left), half sea (right) The land half has the same given type. Uses the getGame() method to access the currently running game. Does not call Game.setMap(Map) with the returned map.
        Parameters:
        landTileType - The type of land with which to initialize the map.
        explored - Set to true if you want all the tiles on the map to have been explored by all players.
        Returns:
        The map created as described above.

      • getStandardColony

        public Colony getStandardColony()
        Get a standard colony at the location 5,8 with one free colonist
        Returns:
        The Colony as specified.

      • getStandardColony

        public Colony getStandardColony(int numberOfSettlers)
        Get a colony with the given number of settlers
        Parameters:
        numberOfSettlers - The number of settlers to put into the colony. Must be >= 1.
        Returns:
        The Colony as specified.

      • getStandardColony

        public Colony getStandardColony(int numberOfSettlers,
                                int tileX,
                                int tileY)
        Get a colony with the given number of settlers, at a specified location.
        Parameters:
        numberOfSettlers - The number of settlers to put into the colony. Must be >= 1.
        tileX - Coordinate of tile for the colony.
        tileY - Coordinate of tile for the colony.
        Returns:
        The Colony as specified.

      • clearWorkLocation

        public boolean clearWorkLocation(WorkLocation wl)
        Useful utility to make sure a work location is empty before doing some test that implicates it.
        Parameters:
        wl - The WorkLocation to clear.
        Returns:
        True if the work location is clear, false if there was a problem removing a unit.

        public void setProductionBonus(Colony colony,
                               int value)
        Set the production bonus of the given colony to the given value.
        Parameters:
        colony - a Colony value
        value - an int value

                                                                 FreeColGameObject attacker,
                                                                 FreeColGameObject defender)
        Repeatedly ask the CombatModel for an attack result until it gives the primary one we want (WIN, LOSE, NO_RESULT).

      • checkCombat

        public void checkCombat(java.lang.String name,
                        java.util.List<CombatModel.CombatResult> crs,
                        CombatModel.CombatResult... results)
        Check a combat result list.
        Parameters:
        name - A base string for the error message.
        crs - The list of CombatResult to check.
        results - The expected CombatResults.

                       java.util.List<AbstractGoods> goods,
                       AbstractGoods... results)
        Check a list of goods.
        Parameters:
        err - A base string for the error message.
        goods - A list of expected AbstractGoods to check.
